SM.1.A.name: Is there a software security assurance program in place?

SM.1.B.name: Are development staff aware of future plans for the assurance program?

SM.1.C.name: Do the business stakeholders understand your organization’s risk profile?

SM.2.A.name: Are many of your applications and resources categorized by risk?

SM.2.B.name: Are risk ratings used to tailor the required assurance activities?

SM.2.C.name: Does the organization know about what’s required based on risk ratings?

SM.3.A.name: Is per-project data for the cost of assurance activities collected?

SM.3.B.name: Does your organization regularly compare your security spend with that of other organizations?

PC.1.A.name: Do project stakeholders know their project’s compliance status?

PC.1.B.name: Are compliance requirements specifically considered by project teams?

PC.2.A.name: Does the organization utilize a set of policies and standards to control software development?

PC.2.B.name: Are project teams able to request an audit for compliance with policies and standards?

PC.3.A.name: Are projects periodically audited to ensure a baseline of compliance with policies and standards?

PC.3.B.name: Does the organization systematically use audits to collect and control compliance evidence?

EG.1.A.name: Have developers been given high-level security awareness training?

EG.1.B.name: Does each project team understand where to find secure development best-practices and guidance?

EG.2.A.name: Are those involved in the development process given role-specific security training and guidance?

EG.2.B.name: Are stakeholders able to pull in security coaches for use on projects?

EG.3.A.name: Is security-related guidance centrally controlled and consistently distributed throughout the organization?

EG.3.B.name: Are developers tested to ensure a baseline skill-set for secure development practices?

TA.1.A.name: Do projects in your organization consider and document likely threats?

TA.1.B.name: Does your organization understand and document the types of attackers it faces?

TA.2.A.name: Do project teams regularly analyze functional requirements for likely abuses?

TA.2.B.name: Do project teams use a method of rating threats for relative comparison?

TA.2.C.name: Are stakeholders aware of relevant threats and ratings?

TA.3.A.name: Do project teams specifically consider risk from external software?

TA.3.B.name: Are the majority of the protection mechanisms and controls captured and mapped back to threats?

SR.1.A.name: Do project teams specify security requirements during development?

SR.1.B.name: Do project teams pull requirements from best practices and compliance guidance?

SR.2.A.name: Do stakeholders review access control matrices for relevant projects?

SR.2.B.name: Do project teams specify requirements based on feedback from other security activities?

SR.3.A.name: Do stakeholders review vendor agreements for security requirements?

SR.3.B.name: Are audits performed against the security requirements specified by project teams?

SA.1.A.name: Are project teams provided with a list of recommended third-party components?

SA.1.B.name: Are project teams aware of secure design principles and do they apply them consistently?

SA.2.A.name: Do you advertise shared security services with guidance for project teams?

SA.2.B.name: Are project teams provided with prescriptive design patterns based on their application architecture?

SA.3.A.name: Do project teams build software from centrally-controlled platforms and frameworks?

SA.3.B.name: Are project teams audited for the use of secure architecture components?

DR.1.A.name: Do project teams document the attack perimeter of software designs?

DR.1.B.name: Do project teams check software designs against known security risks?

DR.2.A.name: Do project teams specifically analyze design elements for security mechanisms?

DR.2.B.name: Are project stakeholders aware of how to obtain a formal secure design review?

DR.3.A.name: Does the secure design review process incorporate detailed data-level analysis?

DR.3.B.name: Does a minimum security baseline exist for secure design review results?

IR.1.A.name: Do project teams have review checklists based on common security related problems?

IR.1.B.name: Do project teams review selected high-risk code?

IR.2.A.name: Can project teams access automated code analysis tools to find security problems?

IR.2.B.name: Do stakeholders consistently review results from code reviews?

IR.3.A.name: Do project teams utilize automation to check code against application-specific coding standards?

IR.3.B.name: Does a minimum security baseline exist for code review results?

ST.1.A.name: Do projects specify security testing based on defined security requirements?

ST.1.B.name: Is penetration testing performed on high risk projects prior to release?

ST.1.C.name: Are stakeholders aware of the security test status prior to release?

ST.2.A.name: Do projects use automation to evaluate security test cases?

ST.2.B.name: Do projects follow a consistent process to evaluate and report on security tests to stakeholders?

ST.3.A.name: Are security test cases comprehensively generated for application-specific logic?

ST.3.B.name: Does a minimum security baseline exist for security testing?

IM.1.A.name: Do projects have a point of contact for security issues or incidents?

IM.1.B.name: Does your organization have an assigned security response team?

IM.1.C.name: Are project teams aware of their security point(s) of contact and response team(s)?

IM.2.A.name: Does the organization utilize a consistent process for incident reporting and handling?

IM.2.B.name: Are project stakeholders aware of relevant security disclosures related to their software projects?

IM.3.A.name: Are incidents inspected for root causes to generate further recommendations?

IM.3.B.name: Do projects consistently collect and report data and metrics related to incidents?

EH.1.A.name: Do projects document operational environment security requirements?

EH.1.B.name: Do projects check for security updates to third-party software components?

EH.2.A.name: Is a consistent process used to apply upgrades and patches to critical dependencies?

EH.2.B.name: Do projects leverage automation to check application and environment health?

EH.3.A.name: Are stakeholders aware of options for additional tools to protect software while running in operations?

EH.3.B.name: Does a minimum security baseline exist for environment health (versioning, patching, etc)?

OE.1.A.name: Are security notes delivered with each software release?

OE.1.B.name: Are security-related alerts and error conditions documented on a per-project basis?

OE.2.A.name: Do projects utilize a change management process that’s well understood?

OE.2.B.name: Do project teams deliver an operational security guide with each product release?

OE.3.A.name: Are project releases audited for appropriate operational security information?

OE.3.B.name: Is code signing routinely performed on software components using a consistent process?
